title: Bitcoin's BIGGEST Risk, Rate Cuts Incoming & 2026 Predictions

chunks.text: [music] All eyes on Powell. Bitcoin chops mostly sideways as markets await Wednesday's Fed meeting. That's not good. Digital asset treasuries were flavor of the month not so long ago, but it seems the market is now losing its taste for them. The big driver. We examine the main factor that will determine how markets perform next [music] year and whether the omens are good or bad. and a look at last week's top performers, tweets of the week, Lewis with the TA, a portfolio competition update, and much more besides. This is the Coin Bureau News Live. This is the Coin Bureau News Live. You are in the right place. Welcome everyone. It is great to see you again. My name is Guy and I am joined as ever by Nick. Hello, sir. >> There you go. How you doing? >> I'm all right, thanks. All right. >> Okay. How was your weekend? My weekend uh it was all right. I went to a Christmas drinks and overdid it on the drinks. Oh >> and uh Sunday was tough but as per usual >> yes I seem to be I seem to be stuck in a bit of a rut like that. It must be must be something to do with me not getting much joy from the crypto market. >> I don't think any of us are getting joy from the crypto market but some of us actually do some healthy stuff to get rid of our stress and release and >> you you had a nice whole suit again. Do you? >> I did but then I also think I caught I got a bit sick you know. I don't know what happened. Must have been from the crypto conference I was attending last week. Someone >> Yes. You know. >> Yes. We were at Binance Blockchain Week last week. >> Someone brought some germs and pass it on to me. >> Okay. That's where patient zero was. >> That's exactly why I don't go to We shouldn't go to crypto conferences. >> Okay. There you go. You never know what you're going to catch. Um so great great to see you everyone. Thanks for joining. Uh today, as we said in the headlines, we're going to kick off by talking about Bitcoin, as we always do, and uh then a couple of other things as well, including uh as we mentioned, uh that all important factor that we really need to be keeping an eye on for the sake of all our bags. But before we get into the meat of it, um don't forget to well, don't forget to subscribe if you for some reason have managed not to do that already >> and the bell of course, >> ring the bell and hit the like button. You will see just below Nick there, there is a little progress bar. If we get to 1,000 likes and 100% on that progress bar today, I will reveal some portfolio changes uh that I've either just made um or am considering making. I shared these with our Coin Bureau Club members uh earlier today. So, if you give us >> some trades you've also shorted he's also shorted some. >> I do have a couple of trades on. I'm not normally a trader, but you know, you've got to entertain yourself somehow in this market. So, >> copy trade guy, guys. Come on. >> Yeah. or you or or you could inverse me, which may be a good idea as well. But yeah, hit the like button and you will find out a bit later on if we get to 1,000 likes. That was at about 88 or 89K. So, you're slightly up. So, that portfolio competition is still ongoing. So hang around till the end of the stream if you want to participate this week and see where we're at in terms of what the value is at. >> Okay. And uh just one more point of housekeeping Brett. I'll let you get away with it once for mentioning the England cricket team. No more no more mentioning of England or cricket. >> No more mention of cricket ever in any streams ever going forward. Please make that a policy >> unless we win the next test. But uh yeah, I'll let you I'll let you off this time Brett, but I'm I'm keeping receipts. Okay. Uh what happened last week in Bitcoin, Nick? Well, if you recall on Monday, it was quite a shocker.

Uh this was because our friends over there in Japan, UEA, the Japanese central bank governor uh basically caused the markets to crash because um there was expectations for rate cut potentially coming in the next few weeks and the markets adjusted and this brought back fe uh you know memories of the >> Japanese carry trade unwind of last year. >> Uh although to be fair it wasn't as bad as August. Um and the markets did duly recover uh in a day but but crypto took a bit longer to recover than the other markets. >> Surprise, surprise, >> surprise, surprise. Exactly. Um Sailor did come out on last week, Monday, and actually he announced this, not a Bitcoin buy, >> but a $1.44 billion cash reserve. Cash fiat. Can you imagine [clears throat] sailor stacking fiat instead of Bitcoin? >> Oh, he must feel so >> so dirty, right? He's has to go and shower after that, you know. >> He can't be like that. >> But anyways, this is the $ 1.44 billion uh reserve for dividends and interest, which we will talk a bit more about a bit later. >> Mhm. >> On Tuesday, can you believe this? Bank of America came out and they said they're going they recommending for their clients, their retail clients, uh 1 to 4% crypto allocation, uh and they could invest in these different products, uh FBTC, IBIT, Grayscales, Mini Trust, etc. So just Bitcoin products right now, but 1 to 4% is pretty large for the size of Bank of America's client base. >> Yeah. Now, it wasn't just Bank of America that we we kind of had a double whammy of holdouts uh finally breaking down last week because Vanguard as well. Now, these guys, you may remember when the spot bitcoin ETFs launched in January 24, these guys were like, "No thanks. No, we're not touching it." Um, but they have finally caved. They've seen the absolutely obscene amounts of money that their the likes of Black Rockck have made from IBIT. >> Oh yeah, exactly. It's one of its most profitable product ever actually IBIT. So Vanguard is now offering this to their clients and you know the floodgates are slowly opening. Uh and Bitcoin did start recovering back above 90K on Tuesday. And speaking about IBIT actually this on this day you had the volumes on IBIT were insane. In fact, I think that um the volume actually speaking of Vanguard as well, the volume on IBIT actually exceeded the volumes on Vanguard's flagship S&P 500 ETF. >> Wow. >> It's crazy. >> Wow. Vanguard must be >> That's why that's why exactly. >> Okay. Um so yeah, we we it looked like we were getting a bit of good news. Um then uh weddednesday came and the news was certainly not good. We had uh weak ADP numbers. >> Exactly. So the ADP numbers, these are private payroll numbers. Uh and this was we saw them shed employers shed 32,000 jobs in November >> and this is actually the third consecutive negative print in or not a third negative print in the last four months. So you can see the trend there. It's not looking good on the employment front. >> No. And then actually this was confirmed the following day on Thursday when we had uh yet more layoff announcements. And this um NBC was saying uh yeah the highest level since the pandemic. >> Yeah. This is for the challenger survey as well. Another private payroll survey. Yeah, the largest since the pandemic level. So the job market's not looking too good. >> So I mean that you guess must be a kind of combination of economic uncertainty.

So their guidance is important for all these indexes. So Msei is now reviewing whether firms that have over 50% of their uh digital asset exposure in their in their assets should stay in these benchmarks. >> Yeah. And this is an important distinction to make because uh you know MSCI is viewing DATs as more like as being more like fund fund-like entities and funds are generally excluded from MSCIS indices. >> Yeah. And if they vote to exclude it, what will happen then is all these index funds, all these funds that track the indexes like these large institutional funds will have to then automatically and programmatically sell out of these DAT shares including strategy. >> Yeah. So if strategy is removed from I can't remember which MCI index is it the MSCI world. Yeah. >> So if it is removed from that index that mean that will mean automatic selling of MSTR stock. And the big date to watch from this, we're just just over a month out from it. So slightly related to this is uh like we mentioned earlier, Strategy's new dividend policy. So as we mentioned, it's a 1.44 44 billion cash reserve to support dividend dividend payments on its preferred stock and interest on outstanding debt. >> Yeah. And it basically used an at the market program to sell a load of uh class A common stock in order to in order to fund it. >> Yeah. So basically diluting the common shareholders for the preferred to pay the preferred. There it is. No one can really fully define it or explain it, but it's just this magical force that should drive our bags higher. Uh so this is a chart actually. It's quite interesting because pre previously it had been Bitcoin had been tracking global liquidity quite well. >> Uh but something seems to have happened out there in earlier the year. >> The lines [clears throat] aren't going in the right direction. >> Bitcoin's basically like he's lost its way. It's it's lost in the woods. Uh while global liquidity keeps on increasing. Uh so now there many people have wondered why is this the case? Uh and there was this report that was released. There's a few factors and there was this report that was released by Arc Invest about a week or two ago and it explains some of that away. For one, uh US liquidity bottomed at 5.56 trillion on October 30 uh 30th after a $621 billion drain from the US government shutdown. So the US government shutdown meant that on the fiscal side there could not be any government spending. >> Yeah. But uh since that shutdown lifted, $70 billion has already flowed back and there's another $300 billion expected within the next 5 to6 weeks as the as the Treasury General account as that kind of normalizes and gets back to gets back to par so to speak. >> Exactly. The TGA level is still quite elevated at $892 billion versus your typical say $600 billion. >> Yeah. Meanwhile, of course, as we discussed earlier, the Fed is, it seems, turning more doubbish. Um, multiple officials are signaling support for rate cuts, and we almost certainly are going to get a rate cut on weddednesday. >> Yeah. And and macro data, as we mentioned, employment, it is weakening. Unemployment is at 4.4%. There's job losses, there's soft retail sales, and there's cooling wholesale inflation, as well as terrible consumer sentiment numbers. >> Yeah. And of course on the 1st of December, just over a week ago, quantitative tightening QT finally came to an end. >> Yeah. And I think the most important thing to point out here, guys, is that and especially as it relates to that chart is asset prices don't tend to react just to the absolute number. It's the changes in that liquidity. So these changes around the margin to the Treasury General account to uh other conditions, quantitative tightening, etc. that is what's going to have the most impact on these asset prices. >> Yeah. So, we're basically waiting for that liquidity to uh you know to begin flowing into into assets. I now let's be let's be clear. It's it's going to flow into all assets. It's not just going to flow into crypto. But you would imagine um that Bitcoin and crypto will will attract some of that liquidity at least. >> Yeah, exactly.
